item.title: Microservices using an API Gateway.
item.description: The big picture: (slashquery API Gateway) api.example.com/<path endpoint> | (plugins) (upstream) (microservices) | /home | /* >--[middleware]---[LoadBalancer]--< /home | /home | | /foo | /foo/* >--[middleware]---[LoadBalancer]--< /foo | /foo | | /foo-version-2 (versioning) | /foo/* >--[middleware]---[LoadBalancer]--< /foo-version-2 | /foo-version-2 | | /bar ` /bar/* >--[middleware]---[LoadBalancer]--< /bar /bar More about versioning: https://violetear.org/post/versioning/ The configuration file in YAML format: config: host: ~ # listen all IP's port: 80 resolver: 8.

item.title: Build your API Gateway
item.description: Because of the plugins (middleware) is not possible to have a generic binary, therefore after creating the configuration file and based on the plugins defined the gateway needs to be build. Setup Setup go environment https://golang.org/doc/install go >= 1.7 is required For example using $HOME/go for your workspace export GOPATH=$HOME/go Create the directory: mkdir -p $HOME/go/src/github.com/slashquery Clone project into that directory: git clone git@github.com:slashquery/slashquery.git $HOME/go/src/github.com/slashquery/slashquery Create your configuration file and type make CONFIG=/path/to/slashquery.

item.title: The configuration file
item.description: The configuration file is composed of 3 sections: config routes upstreams Example: config: socket: /tmp/slashquery.sock routes: get: path: /get upstream: httpbin methods: - GET upstream: httpbin: servers: - httpbin.org The config allow the following options: debug host port request-id resolver socket

item.title: Plugins
item.description: Plugins are handlers that satisfy the http.Handler. They are declared in the routes section of the configuration file for example: foo: url: http://foo.example.com plugins: # the order of the plugins meters - ["github.com/slashquery-plugins/requestid", "requestid.RequestID"] - ["github.com/slashquery-plugins/waf", "waf.WAF"] - ["github.com/slashquery-plugins/cors", "cors.CORS"] - ["github.com/slashquery-plugins/prometheus", "prometheus.Prometheus"] The plugins section is a list of plugins each of one defined within a list, for example: - ["github.com/path/to/myplugin", "myplugin.MyPlugin"] In this case, the first element of the list, should be the path/url where the plugin is located and that could be used as an import path:

item.title: Using Nginx and slashquery through unix socket
item.description: Nginx configuration: upstream slashquery { server unix:/tmp/slashquery.sock keepalive 60; } server { listen 80 default_server; server_name _; location / { proxy_pass http://slashquery; proxy_http_version 1.1; # for keep-alive proxy_redirect off; proxy_set_header Host $http_host; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for; proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr; } } SlashQuery configuration: config: socket: /tmp/slashquery.sock ... When socket is defined host and port are ignored.
